game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Player

  • public class Player
extends Object
    This class represents the player in the stock market simulation game.

    • Method Detail

      • absoluteMoneyChange

        public void absoluteMoneyChange(double amount)
        This method adds the given amount of money. It's a bit more flexible than the other methods since it can add negative values.
        Parameters:
        amount - A double corresponding to the amount to be added.

      • absoluteStockChange

        public void absoluteStockChange(double amount)
        This method picks a random stock and inflicts a random change to it, in absolute value up or down.
        Parameters:
        amount - A double corresponding to the number of stocks to be added or removed - it is a double so as to avoid crashing the program if someone put in decimal numbers - the actual number will be truncated and turned into an integer.

      • addBitCoin

        public int addBitCoin(String startDate,
                      int intervalLength,
                      int numberOfIntervals,
                      int index)
               throws IOException
        addBitCoin method - Add a Bitcoins
        Parameters:
        startDate - Date to start retrieving data
        intervalLength - length of interval in days to retrieve
        numberOfIntervals - to retrieve
        index - the current index to start at
        Returns:
        the status of the operation 0- Investment already on list, 1, Investment Added
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addMetal

        public int addMetal(PreciousMetal.Metal type,
                    String startDate,
                    int intervalLength,
                    int numberOfIntervals,
                    int index)
             throws NumberFormatException,
                    IOException
        addMetal method - Add a stock to players list of stocks
        Parameters:
        type - type of metal
        startDate - - StartDate of simulation used to get data
        intervalLength - - Length in Days of interval
        numberOfIntervals - - Total intervals for simulation length
        Returns:
        status, 0- Investment already on list, 1, Investment Added
        Throws:
        IOException
        NumberFormatException

      • addOwnedInvestment

        public void addOwnedInvestment(Investment ownedInvestment)
        Adds a given stock to the list of owned stocks.
        Parameters:
        ownedInvestment - An Investment object corresponding to the stock one one apparently owns.

      • addStock

        public int addStock(String stockSymbol,
                    String startDate,
                    int intervalLength,
                    int numberOfIntervals,
                    int index)
             throws IOException
        addStock method - Add a stock to players list of stocks
        Parameters:
        stockSymbol - - Symbol of stock to add
        startDate - - StartDate of simulation used to get data
        intervalLength - - Length in Days of interval
        numberOfIntervals - - Total intervals for simulation length
        Returns:
        status, 0- Investment already on list, 1, Investment Added
        Throws:
        IOException

      • buyInvestment

        public int buyInvestment(int index,
                         int quantity)
        Increases the quantity of the stock at the given index in the Stocklist If the quantity to be bought exceeds the user's currentMoney in value, nothing will be done.
        Parameters:
        index - An integer corresponding to the symbol of the stock to buy.
        quantity - An integer corresponding to the amount of stock to buy.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating status 0-Must be a positive integer, 1-Transaction Succeeded, 2-Not enough money to buy stock, 3-stock index out of range 4- investment unavailable at this time

      • getCurrentMoney

        public double getCurrentMoney()
        Returns the current balance of the player
        Returns:
        A double corresponding to the money the player started with.

      • getInitialMoney

        public double getInitialMoney()
        Returns the initial starting balance of the users account
        Returns:
        A double corresponding to the money the player started with.

      • getInvestmentList

        public String[] getInvestmentList()
        Returns an itemized list of stocks as a string
        Returns:
        A numbered string listing of each stock

      • getInvestmentListArray

        public ArrayList<Investment> getInvestmentListArray()
        Returns a cloned ArrayList that is the ArrayList of stocks the player class has.
        Returns:
        copiedStockList An ArrayList containing Stocks.

      • getInvestmentListReport

        public String getInvestmentListReport()
        Returns an itemized list of stocks as a string
        Returns:
        A numbered string listing of each stock

      • getNetWorth

        public double getNetWorth()
        Returns the networth of the player as an aggregate of account balance and current value of stocks
        Returns:
        net worth of players stock value and accounts

      • getUserName

        public String getUserName()
        Gets userName.
        Returns:
        userName A string corresponding to the username of the player.

      • getWealthHistory

        public double getWealthHistory(int index)
        Returns the net worth of the player at a particular turn index
        Returns:
        Net Worth at the time index

      • getWealthHistoryArray

        public ArrayList<Double> getWealthHistoryArray()

      • getWittyPhrase

        public String getWittyPhrase()
        Returns the wittyPhrase defined by the player
        Returns:
        A string corresponding to the user's catch phrase.

      • isInvestmentOnList

        public boolean isInvestmentOnList(String name)
        Determines if an investment is already on the list
        Parameters:
        name - the name of investment to check
        Returns:
        true if name already exists on list

      • percentMoneyChange

        public void percentMoneyChange(double amount)
        This method calculates the amount of money lost by the player assuming it was a percentage loss, and applies it.
        Parameters:
        amount - A double corresponding to the percent multiplier to the currentMoney value. 0 would be to remove all money; 200 doubles the value and 1000 multiplies it by ten.

      • percentStockChange

        public void percentStockChange(double amount)
        This method picks a random stock and inflicts a random change to it, in percentage up or down.
        Parameters:
        amount - A double corresponding to the percent multiplier to the number of stocks. 0 would be to remove all stocks; 200 doubles the value and 1000 multiplies it by ten. After multiplying, it will truncated to the local integer value.

      • sellInvestment

        public int sellInvestment(int index,
                          int quantity)
        Decreases the quantity of the stock at the given index in the investmentlist If the quantity to sell exceeds the user's stock quantity nothing will be done.
        Parameters:
        index - An integer corresponding to the symbol of the stock to buy.
        quantity - An integer corresponding to the amount of stock to buy.
        Returns:
        A status code 0- Not a positive integer, 1 - Transaction Successful, 2 - Not enough stock units to sell, 3 Stock index out of range

      • setCurrentMoney

        public void setCurrentMoney(double moneyValue)
        Sets the current account balance of the player
        Parameters:
        moneyValue - A double corresponding to the user's currentMoney value.

      • setInitialMoney

        public void setInitialMoney(double moneyValue)
        Sets the initial account balance for the player
        Parameters:
        moneyValue - A double corresponding to the user's initialMoney value.

      • setInvestmentList

        public void setInvestmentList(ArrayList<Investment> listInvestments)
        Sets the player's investmentList to a copy of the fed in list of stocks.
        Parameters:
        listInvestments - An ArrayList of type Stock

      • setUserName

        public void setUserName(String name)
        Sets the users name.
        Parameters:
        name - A string corresponding to the userName.

      • setWittyPhrase

        public void setWittyPhrase(String phrase)
        Sets wittyPhrase.
        Parameters:
        phrase - A String corresponding to the intended wittyPhrase.

      • updatePortfolio

        public int updatePortfolio(int index)
        updates the portfolio based on the simulation turn
        Parameters:
        index - the index to set portfolio prices
        Returns:
        status 0-failure, 1-Success, 2-Index out of Range
